Job Description:
* Medical Clinical Responsibilities:

To ensure the provisioning of a comprehensive maternity and gynecology services to all
women including diagnoses conditions in the ladies after giving birth, including bleeding,
oedema, breathing, and other conditions,
• To ensure an accurate and timely medical treatment to clients including examination
and/or administering appropriate health condition including health assessment,
monitoring, vaccination and to document service provision accordingly,
• To complete general medicine schedule for consultation, when general medicine doctor
is not available, and keep communication to department
• Provide clinical support and decision making around unwell women who need to be
retrieved and monitored for a higher level of care,Ensuring the administering of essential medical health care of the women, using
monitoring appropriate devices, administering medication,
• Ensure staff (midwives/nurses) are appropriately trained on the utilization of medical
equipment to patient with maximum efficiency and effectiveness, compliance with
infection control policies,
• Completes patient and employee incident reports and related paperwork within 24 hours
and communicating appropriately to relevance people including family/guardians, and
updating Orchid’s medical and management team,
• To provide medical technical support to Orchid’s Telehealth (hotline) services,
• When on acute duty, away from the clinic, it requires to remain immediately contactable
and available in person and/or an assigned medical professional within 1 hour time
period, and to attend emergency caesarean as requested

* Management and Leadership Responsibilities:

• Participate in administrative tasks such as preparation of maternity/gynecology clinical
guidelines, protocols and informational materials for colleagues and clients,
• To contribute to the development of Information Education Communication (IEC) for
marketing purpose via social media, serving as technical expert,
• To manage the clinical workload effectively, supporting team in ensuring care is
prioritized appropriately,
• To assist in ensuring the safety of the unit, actively participating in clinical audit, clinical
risk and quality issues, including reporting of critical incidents,
• To maintain effective links with the maternity unit, pediatric department, the
multidisciplinary team and the maternity/gynecology network units,
• To provide training and support to staff leaning and development, and provide relevant
recommendation for improvement,
• Undertake other duties and responsibilities as assigned by supervisor.
Qualifications:
• Experienced maternity/gynecology/general medical doctor
• Current, active, professional licensure to practice in the Kingdom of Cambodia
Job Requirement:
* Skills and Experience:

• Demonstrable success in managing and leading maternity/gynecology services.
• Ability to work independently, handle multiple assignments and prioritize workload,
manage day-to-day unit activities
• Have a genuine empathy with patients, the general public and staff at all levels.
• Committed to personal, professional development, provision patient focused services.
• Demonstrated interpersonal/verbal communication skills - fluent in Khmer
written/spoken, good command of English is highly desirable,
• Required Intermediate Microsoft Excel knowledge, learn approved software
• Highly analytical and strategic with excellent foresight and problem-solving skills

* Attitude / Motivation:

• Calm when things go wrong or when things get hectic. This is important when dealing
with women who are critically ill or physically very fragile.
• Customer focused – committed to ensuring a positive hospital experience for patients
and their relatives/careers
• Ability to work together and work smarter in a truthful and helpful manner.
• Accepts responsibility for actions.
• Ability to provide inspirational and motivational leadership,
• Committed to reproductive health in development and an individual’s right to control
their own fertility.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  012 322 027 job@orchidkohpich.com.kh Koh Pich , Phnom Penh. 012 322 027

Job Description:
* Planning and budgeting:
Provide leadership and contribute in formatting the Company’s strategic and business plan
particularly development of short-term and long-term financial objectives and forecast.
• Monitor/direct the implementation of business plan and actively take lead in decision and correct
action towards the efforts to achieve the set financial objectives/KPIs.
• Identify undesirable trends, potential business opportunities, makes recommendations for action.
• Develops long/short-range operational and capital budgets supported by Orchid’s business plans,
• Assists CEO/COO in the development of Orchid’s operations plans, resources availability and cost
benefit analyses staff expansions.

* Operations:

• Participate in key decisions as a member of the executive management team.
• Maintain in-depth relations with all members of the management team and be proactive in initiating
finance/ accounting conversation with other management in order to ensure insightful and accurate
information/ analysis.
• Manage the accounting, investor relations, tax, and treasury departments.
• Develop/ improve inventory management and control process together with relevant team (e.g.,
warehouse team) to ensure accuracy.
• Oversee the financial operations of subsidiary companies and foreign operations, if applicable.
• Lead ERP working team including IT and other departments for ERP/HIS implementation,
integration between each system and on-going improvement.
• Implement financial and operational across multi-functions best practices.
• Enhance and/or develop, implement and enforce policies and procedures by way of systems that
will improve the overall operation and effectiveness of the company.
• Lead establishment of financial and accounting function for new entities/new site opened/invested
by the group.
• Maintain good banking relationship and represent company of the investors.

* Financial and Accounting Management:

Oversee the issuance of consolidated financial information (e.g., management account, financial
statements, operating KPIs).
• Be accountable for financial results reporting to EXCO.
• Produce and provide timely and accurate analysis of budgets, financial reports and financial trends in
order to assist the management in performing their responsibilities (including sales direction,
product profitability study, and cost control).
• Lead and perform feasibility study for a new investment/new products and service/ expansion plan.
• Establishing an efficient management and statutory monthly reporting system and adhering to tax
laws and local regulatory compliance and accounting standards.
• Counselling senior management on cash management and implementing cost saving and margin
improvement initiatives.
Provide technical financial advice and knowledge to others within the finance discipline.
• Develop a reliable cash flow projection process and reporting mechanism that includes minimum
cash threshold to meet operating needs.
• Lead and coordinate with independent external auditors to ensure Orchid’s compliance.
* Risk Management
Understand and mitigate key elements of the company's risk profile
• Monitor all open legal issues involving the company, and legal issues affecting the industry
Work in consultation with other management to construct and monitor reliable control systems
• Review/maintain appropriate insurance coverage.
• Ensure that the company complies with all legal, tax, custom, and other regulatory requirements
• Report risk issues to EXCO.
• Maintain relations with external auditors and investigate their findings and recommendations.
• Develop contingency plans for the Company to withstand liquidity crises and update such plans as
the need arises.

* Funding:

• Monitor cash balances and cash forecasts as well as ensure healthy cash cycle and strong cashflow
position.
• Optimize return from cash management.

* Supply Chain and Operations:

• Keep costs down.
• Make recommendations to improve productivity, quality, and efficiency of operations.
• Oversee procurement function (direct report).
• Review/monitor Orchid list of suppliers to ensure quality services and deliverables.
• Arrange for debt and equity financing, if needed.

* Investor Relations:
Manage relationships with investors, financial institutions, and external stakeholders, providing
accurate and transparent financial information and participating in investor communications and
presentations.
Job Requirement:
• Have a master's degree in accounting or business administration, or equivalent business experience
10+ years of progressively responsible experience for a major company or division of a large
corporation, preferably health care related sector.
• Must have hands-on experience with financial systems: Xero, Sun, SAP system, Excel
• Experience in partnering with an executive team (highly desirable if worked with private equity)
• Must be able to communicate fluently in Khmer and English both written and speaking.
• Have a good interpersonal and communication skill, team work, and independent.
• Strong experience in process improvement and ERP implementation/ upgrade.
• Preference will be given to candidates with an MBA in Finance and the Certified Public Accountant
(CPA) or ACCA Qualification
• High degree of integrity, ethics, and proven track record of good governance
• Healthcare including clinic, center and/or hospital experience is a plus
• Strong leadership and with good track record of managing and building capacity of people.

* Attitude / Motivation:

• Desire to apply good management/technical skills to achieve business KPIs,
Ability to lead and demonstrate excellent leadership to the team,
• Results oriented and innovative,
• Strong, determined, self-motivated and with strong ethical values,
• Adaptable and flexible; take initiative – take on the can-do attitude,
• Able to work in a pressured environment,
• Committed to reproductive health in development and an individual’s right to control their own
fertility.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  012 322 027 job@orchidkohpich.com.kh Koh Pich , Phnom Penh. 012 322 027

Job Description:
* Marketing/Communication Coordination:

• Develop, produce and manage digital marketing contents and activities
• Coordinate the design of promotional materials and distribute in online and off-line
channels
• Manage and maintain social media including Website, Facebook, YouTube and IG
• Assist manager to produce video script, take video spots and edit to make sure high quality
• Work in team to develop action plans and strategy to generate new clients;
• Assist in developing creative health contents for communication and marketing materials;
Track and analyze website traffic flow and provide regular internal reports;
• Work with printing, advertising and design agencies and other suppliers to produce
marketing and communication tools, and ensure produced items are in good quality;
• Communicate with target clients and assist in managing client’s relationship
• Assist in producing communications tools for a range of internal/external channels such as
presentation/report templates and documents etc..
• Assist in developing a monthly report on Marketing and Communications performance’s
effectiveness, identifying and taking action on areas for improvements
• Organize and attend events to promote Orchid’s brand and health service to potential clients
Assist line manager to evaluate effectiveness of marketing campaign
• Identify target markets and how the best to reach them
• Assist line manager to monitor competitor and identify new market opportunity
• Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the demand generation of
existing and new client;
• Perform others task as line manager assigned.

* Executive Secretary Support:
Provide support to the coordination, documentation of board meetings and annual
shareholder meetings.
• Work in consultation to support financial advisor, board directors and management team
to ensure proper documents are filed and kept accordingly,
• Liaise with investors making inquiries relating investment opportunities,
Job Requirement:
• A bachelor degree in business administration, marketing, communication and or within relevant qualifications is highly desirable.
• Must be well organized, details oriented and able to work across the organization professionally.

* Skills and Experience:

• With 1-2 years of direct experience in digital marketing in health care is an advantage;
• Computer literacy – MS office, Adobe Photoshop, and Illustrator;
• Knowledge of HTML/JavaScript, strong knowledge of search engine optimization and
advanced Word and PowerPoint skills;
• Knowledge/experience of health products is preferable;
• Excellent communication and people skills;
• Aptitude in resolving issues and conflicts;
• Effective communicator, good proficiency in written Khmer and understanding of English,
Attitude / Motivation
Desire to apply good modern management/technical skills to achieve business KPIs,
• Ability to lead and demonstrate excellent leadership to the team,
• Must have strong ethical and moral value,
• Results oriented and innovative,
• Strong, determined, self-motivated and with strong ethical values,
• Adaptable and flexible; take initiative – take on the can-do attitude,
• Able to work in a pressured environment,
• Committed to reproductive health in development and an individual’s right to control their own fertility.

* Confidentiality:

• Staff members have a legal duty of confidence to patients. Any employee disclosing confidential/
patient records or information to any unauthorized person or persons will render the
employee subject to disciplinary action, which may result in dismissal.

Job Description:
With the task of overseeing all IT functions of the company, the Manager needs to have expert knowledge of the industry’s best practices and stay up-to-date with advances. Their main responsibilities include:

•	Supervising daily operations of network and server infrastructure
•	Aligning IT infrastructure with current and future business requirements and goals
•	Evaluating risk, developing network recovery and backup processes
•	Assessing and purchasing new and replacement hardware
•	Testing, troubleshooting and adjusting information systems to operate effectively
•	Implementing security of the network, data and its storage and communication systems
•	Running regular checks on networks and data security
•	Identifying and acting on opportunities to improve and update software and systems
•	Designing training programs and workshops for staff
•	Conducting regular system audits
•	Running and sharing regular operating system reports with senior staff
•	Overseeing and determining timeframes for major IT projects including system updates, upgrades, migrations, and outages
•	Providing direction for IT team members
•	Identifying opportunities for team training and skills advancement
•	Managing CCTV system
•	Managing IT infrastructure, servers system, network switches and firewall
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor degree in computer science or information technology.
•	At least 5 years’ experience in leading and managing IT team.
•	Strong management skill, technical management, technical understanding, analyzing information, staffing, problem solving, coordination, strategy planning.
•	Experience in designing and deploying network infrastructure.
•	Experience in managing servers and data center.
•	Experience leading and managing IT projects and rolling out IT infrastructure across various technologies.
•	Excellence working knowledge of computer system, security, network and system administrator, databases and data storage systems, and phone system.
•	CCNA certified is a plus.
•	Good listening, negotiation, interpersonal skills, and Strong critical thinking and decision-making skills.
•	Excellent project management skills and strong ability of prioritize.
•	Firm grasps on IT infrastructure and operations best practices.
•	Direct technological researches by studying organization goals and implements technological strategic solutions and practices.
•	Completes projects by coordinating resources and timetables with user departments.
•	Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
•	Accomplish information technology staff results.
•	Coaches, counsels, and disciplines employees.
•	Maintains a safe and secure work environment.
•	Develops personal growth opportunities.
•	Documents all IT implementation

Job Description:
 Ensure Disbursements by products/Portfolio/# of clients/Net Profit/PAR/ Asset backed product/Productivity per CO/write off collection/key ratios achieved as per BP.
 Monitor and verify the list of potential customers from each branches and strategizing with Deposit Department to mobilize the deposit balance.
 Ensure that digital products have been in sales well.
 Ensure the good repayment rate of loans.
 Follow up all product performance of each branch to make sure it is growing as the set plan.
 Initiating/ guiding business strategies to branches under his supervision to achieve higher results.
 Build relationship/partnership with Merchants, authorities, and other parties to improve the business’s opportunities.
 Survey competitor products and services; and find strategies to deal with them.
 Identify the barriers and reason why each product cannot be performed better than its actual
performance.

management.

Job Description:
The key responsibilities of the Purchase and Operation admin include but are not limited to:
- Maintain records of goods ordered and received.
- To obtain minimum of three quotations from the suppliers for each item to be purchased.
- To ensure better prices are obtained.
- To suggest means and ways of reducing costs without effecting the quality and standard of the hotel.
- To take full responsibility in ordering goods on all approved Purchase Orders/Purchase requests.
- Locate vendors of materials, equipment or supplies, and interview them in order to determine product availability and terms of sales.
- Prepare and process requisitions and purchase orders for supplies and equipment before seeking management approval.
- Liaise with finance office for payment after management approval.
- Control department purchasing budgets.
- Review purchase order claims and contracts for conformance to company policy.
- Analyze market and delivery systems in order to assess present and future material availability.
- Develop and implement purchasing and contract management instructions, policies, and procedures.
- Participate in the development of specifications for equipment, products or substitute materials.
- Resolve vendor or contractor grievances, and claims against suppliers.
- Represent company in negotiating contracts and formulating policies with suppliers.
- Review, evaluate according to management approved specifications for issuing and awarding bids.
- Direct and coordinate activities of personnel engaged in buying materials and supplies for daily operations.
- Prepare monthly reports on expenses and utilization.
- Arrange for disposal of write-off materials.
- Work directly with account for payment and document.
- Work procurement team for resource all products.
- Support operation manager and assistant operations.
- Other task assign by management
Job Requirement:
- Previous experience in a purchasing/procurement
- Good financial knowledge and ability to work with budgets
- Computer literate, with good MS Excel skills
- Good time management and organisation skills
- Accountable and resilient
- Ability to work under pressure at all times

SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Assists in general office administration when require

How to Apply
For interested candidates, please forward your detailed CV, including a recent photo with a cover letter describing
your suitability for the role and salary expectation to HR Department.

Cambodia

Job Description: 1.	Work closely with line leadership to understand business and talent pressures in order to propose, develop and implement effective people strategies and solutions.2.	Plan workforce strategically so that the designated organizational unit or function has the capable talent required to deliver business results.3.	Drive the people processes (performance, development, and career) to ensure that employees’ level of performance and capabilities meet current and future standards.4.	Ensure alignment of goals and objectives of the organizational unit or function and those of the employees to maximize organizational and individual performance. 5.	Diagnose and solve organizational issues so that the organizational unit or function can achieve its desired performance and growth levels. 6.	Identify capability gaps in employees and manages and propose learning and development solutions to close the gaps and drive performance, development, engagement and retention. 7.	Provide data-driven people and organizational insights so that line leadership team can make informed business and people decisions.8.	Service as a trusted advisor on people-related matters to line leadership so that they are empowered to deal with people issues.9.	Lead team-building initiatives in order to build trust, engagement and collaboration among employees and managers.10.	Partner with HR Shared Services and Community of Practices to deliver great employee and manager experience of HR services.11.	Drive positive organizational change to promote high-performance culture/organization. 12.	Ensure business and HR process compliance in order to mitigate organizational risks.13.	Manage specific projects as determined in the annual HR operational plan as well as participating in functional and cross-functional initiatives.
Job Requirement: 1.	Education: At least Bachelor's degree (Master’s is preferred) in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Organizational Development or related field2.	Experiences: o	8 years of work experience in the field of human resource management, preferably 2 or 3 years working in a HR-business partnership model.o	 Work experience in private sector, preferably in FMCG, supply chain management or manufacturingo	Experience in using HRMS/SAP or other HR-related systems3.	Skills and knowledge: o	Deep expertise in business acumen, talent strategy, organizational effectiveness and data analysiso	Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including workforce planning, talent acquisition, talent development, performance employee engagement, employee relations, organizational development, and etc.o	Ability to comprehend, interpret, and apply the appropriate sections of applicable laws, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, and policies.o	People skills (broad understanding of human behaviors, motives and/or practical psychology)o	Relationship building, o	Consulting,o	 Project management, o	System thinkingo	Coaching and mentoringo	Strong organizational skillso	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.o	Excellent commination and networking skills o	Computer literacy (Microsoft office and other useful software) o	Language: Strong command both Khmer and English

job title: Officer, Talent Acquisition (at One More Restaurant)
company_name: One Fraternity Co., Ltd. (Vital Premium Water, Mee Chiet)
position: Officer, Talent Acquisition (at One More Restaurant)
Job Description:
1. Execute recruitment and consolidate staff requisitions from all functions and incorporated into recruitment plan to ensure the vacancies are timely fulfilled.
2. Build applicant sources (talent pool) and perform sourcing through offline or online channels to fill open positions and anticipate future needs
3. Prepare job announcements through various recruitment platforms both virtual and off-line channels to acquire potential candidates. 
4. Shortlist candidates following job requirements and implement recruitment process to ensure potential talents are selected
5. Acquire and maintain all necessary documents from employees (CV, academic and employment records, national ID, family book, guarantee letter, medical health checkup, employee book etc…)
6. Record and update employee’s information in HRIS system to ensure that employee data are up-to-date and ready to use
7. Implement onboarding program to ensure that inductions are effectively conducted   
8. Propose sourcing and employer branding techniques to promote employer branding and support recruitment
9. Other talks assigned by superiors
Job Requirement:
1. Education: 
o Bachelor Degree of Business Administrative or equivalent
2. Experiences: 
o 1-2 years of experiences in recruitment or overall HR practices
o Fresh graduate is recommended to apply
3. Skills and knowledge: 
o Knowledge in Cambodia Labor Law
o Have strong talent networks
o Be digitalized oriented
o Good communication and report presentation
o Computer literacy (Microsoft office and other useful software) 
o Language: Strong command both Khmer and English

Job Description:
Summary of Position
Develop go-to market strategies to build up new brands / products awareness; initiate marketing strategies to penetrate new markets as well as maintain existing new markets; and work cooperatively with team to solve all problems arising.

What you will do:
•	Promote new products / brands to target markets.
•	Set up go-to market strategies to build up new brands / products awareness and get the new products / brands information across to target customers
•	Identify market size, segmentation, demands, competitors and concise commercial positioning.
•	Develop product road map and marketing strategies to penetrate new markets as well as maintain existing markets.
•	Work cooperatively with team and related departments to solve problems arising.
•	Perform other tasks as assigned
Job Requirement:
What you should have:
•	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or a related field
•	At least 3 years of experience in Sales and/or Marketing, or a related area 
•	Knowledge of computer programs (MS. Office 365 and SAP system is an advantage)
•	Knowledge of market research
•	Knowledge of strategic planning 
•	Knowledge of marketing and advertising
•	Ability to think creatively and innovatively
•	Strong detail-oriented working personality and skills.
•	Ability to work under pressure
•	Flexibility to travel

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia.

Job Description:

Support General Manager in his/her general role through identifying, planning, and preparing the work schedule of the meeting, agenda, and activities; prepare presentations and reports and communicate regularly with Chip Srun team; and act as a liaison, in coordinating matters, between the General Manager’s Office and other department heads and managers..

•	Schedule, and prepare meeting agenda and materials, and take minutes for various meetings.
•	Act as liaison in coordinating matters between the General Manager’s Office and other department heads and managers.

•	Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Description:
- Check daily attendance of employees, leaves, reconcile the attendance.
- Manage employee profiles and payroll report.

- Verify employees' profile in case of promotion, transfer, demotion.
- Manage OT to ensure compliance with labor law, correct OT calculation

- Bachelor’s degree in management, accounting, or related fields.
- At least 3 years experience in a payroll, preferably from at least 300 employee factory.
- Good at Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
- Good written communication, and report-writing skills in English.
- Have a growth mindset with a positive attitude.

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   012 797 939 hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh #11A, St. 402, Sangkat Tumnup Teuk, Khan Boeung Keng Kang, Phnom Penh. 012 797 939

position: មន្រ្ដីឥណទាន​ (FOE) នៅខេត្តត្បូងឃ្មុំ​( ២៥០ដុល្លារ)
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities
●Explain to customers different loan products under Mango Finance 
●Collecting customer information and documents for loan application 
●Visiting and checking customer’s place of businesses and customer’s house or property
●Supporting Mango Finance customers and dealers to ensure quick and accurate loan application
●Monthly incentives given for reaching targets, and allowances given for traveling
●Other tasks assigned by Manager
Job Requirement:
●Any bachelor degree Business or any related field
●No previous work experience required 
●Proper attitude, and hardworking and polite behavior
●Willing to speak to new customers, good customer service and communication skill 
●Ability to ensure documents are completed accurately and efficiently
Company Profile:
Established in 2021, Mango Finance PLC is a digital microfinance startup based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, capitalized by an investment from Vipar Auto FZCO, Dubai. With direct access to over 100,000 customers, we are capturing the opportunity to lend digitally and securely.

Mango Finance PLC intends to transform the microfinance landscape in Cambodia by leveraging the powers of technology and data. We believe in improving access to capital for the unbanked in Cambodia, with our proprietary credit scoring engine.

Mango Finance PLC is a licensed Microfinance Institution, regulated by the National Bank of Cambodia. Please visit www.mangofinance.net for more information.

Job Description:
To work with the School Leaders and Head of Department, Singapore (Cambodia)
International Academy Co., Ltd. (SCIA), a Cambodia registered subsidiary of SIM International
Academy Pte. Ltd., The Teacher, Early Childhood Education is reporting to Head of
Department and is responsible for:
- Creating daily lesson plans and learning activities for students based on Cambridge
International standards in Early Childhood Education and research and knowledge of
developmental behaviors.
- Delivering high-quality, engaging instruction in the form of discussion, direct teaching,
demonstrations and independent practice using a variety of proven methods.
 Differentiating lessons when needed to give all students access to the curriculum
regardless of disability, instructional level, English proficiency or level of interest in the
subject.
- Evaluating student performance on tasks established by the standards using different
methods such as observation, performance-based tasks or other standard test
practices.
- Maintaining a safe, orderly and supportive classroom by modelling expected
behaviors and standards, promoting positive interactions and quickly addressing
behaviors that are not in line with the school discipline plan.
- Communicating with parents regarding student progress, potential and behaviors
periodically through phone or electronic means and at parent and teacher
conferences.
- Improving skills and knowledge in teaching by regularly taking classes, attending
workshops and discovering new methods of delivering exciting content to students.
- Performing other functions as necessary or assigned by Supervisors / Heads of Division.
- Assisting Supervisors / Heads of Division in any projects or tasks in relation to
company goals and objectives.
- Participating in all School-wide events.
Job Requirement:
1. Academic Education / Training / Experience
- Degree in related Early Childhood Education majors from an internationally
recognized university.
- Teaching certification from a recognized institution.
- Competent in Information Technology for use in Teaching and Learning, as well as
data analysis
- Strong knowledge in curriculum, pedagogy and assessments.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting is an advantage.
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in education institutions.
- Knowledge of Early Childhood Education using Singapore and/or Cambridge
curriculum.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting, as well as managing a department
in school, is an advantage.
2. Personal Attributes 
● Strong passion in education with the ability to inspire students
● Willing to be stationed in Phnom Penh, Cambodia
● Willing to work flexibly in dynamic and fast-paced environment
● Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
● Strong ability in leadership, networking, teamwork, and problem-solving
● Meticulous, analytical and self-driven
● Ability to think strategically
● Ability to work independently, as well as in collaboration with others
● Ability to “think outside the box” in identifying problems and implementing solutions
● Works well under pressure, well organized and with strong attention to details
● Ability to multitask and manage tight deadlines
How to apply
Email: careers_teaching@scia.edu.kh
Company Profile:
Singapore (Cambodia) International Academy (SCIA) endeavours to be the centre of excellence in education and higher learning. SCIA is a member of the Singapore Institute of Management (SIM) Group, the leading provider of a diverse range of education pathways and professional training in Singapore. Recognising the importance of nurturing future leaders in Cambodia, SCIA offers the following programmes to cater to the different needs of learners:
- Early Childhood Education
- Primary Education
- Secondary Education
- Pre-University Education

With the expertise of trained Singapore and international educators, SCIA provides a holistic and rigorous education with a global perspective.

SCIA is a registered school of Cambridge Assessment International Education, and appointed by the Singapore Examinations and Assessment Board (SEAB) as an Overseas Examination Centre to conduct the Singapore International Primary School Examination (iPSLE). SCIA is also appointed by the University of London as the first and only Recognised Teaching Centre in Cambodia to offer the International Foundation Programme (IFP).
Contact Info: Contact Information HR & Admin   +855 61 777 808 careers_corporate@scia.edu.kh One Park, Phnom Penh City Center, No.58, Street R8, Sangkat Srah Chak, Khan Doun Penh, Phnom Penh +855 61 777 808

Job Description:
• Develops CSD/QSR channel marketing programs in line with IAPs targeted to channels and CSD/ED product categories to increase brand awareness and grow & sales
• Development of multi touchpoint shopper marketing initiatives and campaigns based on shopper insight and strong understanding of channel strategy. 
• Working closely with the sales and CSD/ED brand marketing team to ensure that CSD/QSR channel marketing strategies are aligned with objectives and targets with evaluation of its effectiveness.

• Develop and monitor execution of PICOS strategy in the CSD/QSR Channels, get alignment from relevant stakeholders, lead the roll-out and implementation
• Provide input for new POSM development, control its deployment in the CSD/QSR channels
• Develops creative briefs for programs and publications working with external agencies
• Frequent communication with teams to support data collection, issue resolution and requests
• On time submission of CSD/QSR monthly sales and marketing activity plan and report  
• People Development through coaching and succession planning
Job Requirement:
• Minimum bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business Administration, or its equivalent
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Trade Marketing from FMCG/F&B, especially CSD/ED industry
• Minimum 2 years of people management
• Good written and spoken English
• Computer literate – MS Tools (PP, Excel & Word Excellent written and verbal communication skills – English & Khmer Language
• Good interpersonal skills and problem-solving skill 
• Good analytical skills with a problem-solving attitude

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

company_name: Sofitel Angkor Phokeethra Golf & Spa Resort
Job Description:
•To assist the Assistant Finance Manager and oversee daily accounting operations
•To supervise the personnel management in the Accounting department
•To supervise daily accounting operations.
•To perform bank reconciliation and month-end reconciliation of all general ledger balances
•To prepare trial balance and financial reports.
•To review and analyze all accounts before issuing final monthly financial statements.
•To supervise and control subordinates to discharge their duties in an effective and efficient manner.
•To ensure teamwork and efficient operation of the hotel through team spirit development.
•To supervise daily accounting operations.
•To prepare time tables for completing monthly reports and work schedules.
•To be responsible in preparing various monthly reports as required by the management.
•To ensure sub-ledgers and supporting evidence are in order and properly maintained to support the General Ledger.
•To safeguard all contracts and agreements and to supervise the necessary accounting procedures and the preparation of accounting ledgers and summaries.
•To perform other duties as required by the Chief Accountant.
•To review the daily revenue report prepared by the Income Auditor and to prepare the Income journal.
•To verify that journals and journal vouchers are properly recorded and accurate.
•To verify that the general ledger and sub-ledger postings are accurate, ensure that general ledger and sub-ledger balances correspond to and all contra/clearance accounts are cleared at month-end.
•To manage prepaid and accrued expense monthly allocations and other allocated expense calculations and to ensure they are properly accounted for.
Job Requirement:
•Bachelor‘s degree in Accounting
•Excellent in English language
•Proficient in MS Excel, Word
•Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise tasks
•Be able to work effectively as part of a dynamic team
Contact Info: Contact Information Khin Aye Mu HR Manager 063 964 600 h3123-hr@sofitel.com Vithei Charles de Gaulle, Khum Svay Dangkum, Siem Reap 063 964 600

Company Profile:
Since 2013, Naki Group has grown from a local real estate and property management firm into an investment firm focused on developing the Indo-China belt. With representation in Singapore and Seattle, the Group invests in our 3 key pillars of property development, realty services, and hospitality management.

As a developer, Naki Group has completed Silvertown Metropolitan, a 111-unit condominium in 2014, Woodland Residences, an 84-unit luxury villa gated community to be completed in 2022, and Agile Sky Residence, a 44-storey condominium to be completed in 2022.

As a property management firm, Naki Group have served Silvertown Metropolitan, Woodland Residences, Agile Showroom, TK Avenue Community Mall and The One Mall. In addition to managing medium to large projects, our property management services extend to those smaller shops who require janitorial, pest control and sanitization services.

As a hospitality services provider, Naki Group has maintained a high quality standards of stay to our tenants. From long stay to short stay, we ensure enjoyable accommodation coupled with services of convenience.

Now as a growing real estate company, Naki Group is determined to reach out to larger domestic and overseas projects. On a larger scale, investors both financial and expertise will play a large role in achieving the goal of higher and faster returns to our partners.
Contact Info: Contact Information Human Resource   081 990 959 hr@nakigroup.com Koh Pich, Diamond Twin Tower, 22nd Floor, Sopheak Mongkol Rd, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 081 990 959

Job Description: i) តួនាទីដែរត្រូវធ្វើ1)	ស្វែងរកប្រភពថ្មីៗពីទីផ្សារសម្រាប់ប្រាក់កម្ចីទិញម៉ូតូនិងផលិតផលផ្សេងទៀត។2)	ត្រូវជួបជាមួយម្ចាស់ហាងម៉ូតូជារៀងរាល់ថ្ងៃដើម្បីពិភាក្សា ផ្សព្វផ្សាយផលិតផលប្រាក់កម្ចី។ ជំរុញការលក់ផលិតផលតាមរយះការបង់រំលោះ3)	ពិភាក្សាអំពីផលិតផល....លក្ខណៈពិសេសនៃប្រាក់កម្ចីជាមួយអតិថិជន ព្រមទាំងផ្តល់គំនិត សំរាប់ពួកគាត់អំពីអត្ថប្រយោជន៍នៃប្រាក់កម្ចីពីក្រុមហ៊ុនរបស់យើងនិងលក់រាល់ផលិតផលបង់រំលោះរបស់យើង។4)	ទាក់ទងទៅអតិថិជននិងពិភាក្សាដើម្បីស្វែងយល់ពីអំពីប្រាក់ចំណូល ៕ ត្រួតពិនិត្យមើលឯកសារប្រាក់ចំនូលជាក់ស្តែង ហើយប្រាកដថាឯកសារទាំងអស់ពិតប្រាកដនិងត្រឹមត្រូវ។5)	គ្រប់ឯកសារប្រាក់កម្ចីទាំងអស់ត្រូវបំពេញពាក្យស្នើសុំ រួចបញ្ចូនទៅប្រធានមន្រ្តីឥណទាន។ មន្រ្តីឥណទានត្រូវតែប្រាកដនិងធានាថាគ្រប់ព័ត៌មានទិន្នន័យដែរបានបញ្ចូនទៅនោះគឺគ្រប់គ្រាន់ពេញលេញ។6)	ត្រូវតាមដានឯកសារ និង តាមដានពាក្យស្នើសុំកម្ចីនេះបានទទួលការយល់ព្រមឬបដិសេធពីប្រធាន។7)	ត្រូវចុះពិនិត្យមើលផ្ទះនិងទីកន្លែងអាជីវកម្ម/ ហាង ព្រមទាំង យកឯកសារប្រាក់ចំណូល។8)	ត្រូវបំពេញរាល់ឯកសារទាំងអស់ដោយផ្នែកតាមបញ្ជីត្រួតពិនិត្យ។9)	រៀបចំឯកសារសម្រាប់ដំណើរអនុញ្ញាតការផ្តល់កម្ចីនេះ។10)	ចូលរួមក្នុងការបង្កើតនូវទំរងនៃប្រាក់កម្ចី ហើយនិង ដំណើរការនីតិវិធីផ្សេងៗទៀតដែរពាក់ព័ន្ធ។11)	រៀបចំរបាយការណ៍ហើយផ្ញើទៅអ្នកគ្រប់គ្រងផ្ទាល់
Job Requirement: ** គុណវុឌ្ឍិរបស់មន្ត្រីឥណទាន:1- ត្រូវមានចំណេះដឹងទូទៅ និងមានអទិភាពសម្រាប់និស្សិតថ្នាក់បរិញ្ញាបត្រគ្រប់ជំនាញ2- ត្រូវមានបទពិសោធន៍ 1ឆ្នាំ លើការងារឥណទាន 3- មានចំណេះដឹងដូចជា៖ លេខនព្វន្ត និងការកត់ត្រាឱ្យមានភាពត្រឹមត្រូវ ភាសាអង់គ្លេស ដែលអាចអានស្តាប់ និងសរសេរបានខ្លះៗ4- មានប្រវត្តិ និងអត្តចរិតល្អ មានភាពស្មោះត្រង់ ម៉ឺងម៉ាត់ សុភាពរាបសារ មានសុជីវធម៌ល្អ និងមានឆន្ទៈក្នុងការធ្វើការងារជាមួយប្រជាជនក្រីក្រនៅតាមសហគមន៍5- មានប្រាស្រ័យទាក់ទងល្អ ចូលចិត្តធ្វើការងារជាក្រុម ជាមនុស្សឧស្សាហ៍ព្យាយាម និងមានការប្តេជ្ញាចិត្តខ្ពស់ចំពោះការងារ
Company Profile:
Established in 2021, Mango Finance PLC is a digital microfinance startup based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, capitalized by an investment from Vipar Auto FZCO, Dubai. With direct access to over 100,000 customers, we are capturing the opportunity to lend digitally and securely.

Mango Finance PLC intends to transform the microfinance landscape in Cambodia by leveraging the powers of technology and data. We believe in improving access to capital for the unbanked in Cambodia, with our proprietary credit scoring engine.

Mango Finance PLC is a licensed Microfinance Institution, regulated by the National Bank of Cambodia. Please visit www.mangofinance.net for more information.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ngornly Hangming HR Manager 069777629 recruitment.specialist@mangofinance.net Phnom Penh Street Samdach Cheasim,Phum Chres, Sangkat Kouk Khleang, Khan Sens Sok, Phnom Penh. 069777629

Job Description: Job Description•	Check the loan files are completed with all papers as per the checklist and signed/thumb printed.•	Check the loan data in System/software is as per loan file•	Create the new loan product scheme in system as per approved scheme/ product.•	Check that GPS is active and send daily GPS reports•	Control GPS stocks available with company and available with Dealer.•	Prepare the MIS / Excel report for pending papers in file and follow up with Credit and business team and Dealer for completion.•	Send completed file to Accounts for making payment to Dealer•	Provide coaching and training to officer staff,•	Prepare the mid-term financial projection guidelines and key assumptions and ensure their correctness and appropriateness before they are submitted to senior management for approval.•	Perform the other tasks assigned by management.
Job Requirement: Job Requirements•	Hold at least Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related fields.•	At least 3 to 4 years of experience with Banking or MFI•	Have working knowledge of Microfinance business.•	Must have working knowledge of Loan Operating System, Quick Book and similar financial management software•	Good working knowledge of Ms-Excel & Advanced Excel•	Good Speaking and writing in both English and Khmer.
